info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 23 at 1:30AM MDT until June 23 at 7:45AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast New Mexico, including the following county, central Chaves.
* WHEN...Until 745 AM MDT Monday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, washes, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring, particularly near northwestern Roswell and to the west of the U.S. 70 Truck Relief route. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 127 AM MDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rainfall amounts due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 1 and 5 inches of rain have fallen with the highest amounts northwest of Roswell. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roswell, Dexter, Bottomless Lakes State Park, Midway and Greenfield. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM MDT THIS MORNING
